title: Computer-Based Instructional Design for Nursing Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic nursing theory and patient care experience
context.additional_context: Combines theory with digital device-based practical training, measuring learning outcomes through project-based assessments. Learners are office/administrative professionals with advanced domain expertise.

learning_goals: Learners can perform cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) procedures with 90% accuracy through computer-based simulation.
Based on simulation feedback, learners can propose at least three emergency response strategies.
Through team-based project evaluations, learners can write reports applying simulation experiences to real-world nursing cases.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
